codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Units codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Concomitant Medication Dose Units
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Units Terminology

terms.definition: The unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.(NCI)
The unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, 10E-6 cubic meter, or approximately to 0.061 023 7 cubic inch.(NCI)
A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram. (NCI)

The unitage assigned by the WHO (World Health Organization) to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.(NCI)
A dosing measurement based on the tablet unit.(NCI)
A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Form codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Concomitant Medication Dose Form
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Form Terminology

terms.definition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents. (NCI)

A solid pharmaceutical dosage form that contains medicinal agent within either a hard or soft soluble container or shell, usually used for the oral administration of medicine. The shells are made of a suitable form of gelatin or other substance. (NCI)

A suspension or emulsion, semisolid (1) dosage form, usually containing < 20% water and volatiles (2) and > 50% hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols as the vehicle. This dosage form is generally for external application to the skin or mucous membranes. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: Percent water and volatiles are measured by a loss on drying test in which the sample is heated at 105 degrees C until constant weight is achieved.
A solid body of various weights and shapes, adapted for introduction into the rectal orifice of the human body; they usually melt, soften, or dissolve at body temperature.

A product that is packaged under pressure and contains therapeutically active ingredients that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system; it is intended for topical application to the skin as well as local application into the nose (nasal aerosols), mouth (lingual aerosols), or lungs (inhalation aerosols).
A liquid minutely divided as by a jet of air or steam. (NCI)

A liquid dosage form that contains solid particles dispersed in a liquid vehicle. Note: A liquid is pourable; it flows and conforms to its container at room temperature. It displays Newtonian or pseudoplastic flow behavior. (FDA)

A drug delivery system that often contains an adhesive backing that is usually applied to an external site on the body. Its ingredients either passively diffuse from, or are actively transported from, some portion of the patch. Depending upon the patch, the ingredients are either delivered to the outer surface of the body or into the body. A patch is sometimes synonymous with the terms Extended Release Film and System.
Any elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have free paths. (NCI)

A semisolid (1) dosage form that contains a gelling agent to provide stiffness to a solution or a colloidal dispersion (2). A gel may contain suspended particles. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: A colloidal dispersion is a system in which particles of colloidal dimension (i.e., typically between 1 nm and 1 micrometer) are distributed uniformly throughout a liquid.
A semisolid emulsion of either the oil-in-water or the water-in-oil type, ordinarily intended for topical use. (NCI)
An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals that may be intended for internal or external use. (NCI)

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Frequency codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval
codelists.preferredTerm: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval
codelists.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval Terminology

terms.definition: Two times per day, at unspecified times. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Three times per day. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Four times per day. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Every other day. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Every month. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: As needed. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Occurring or done each day. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Route codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Route of Administration codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Concomitant Medication Route of Administration
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Route of Administration Terminology

terms.definition: Administration to or by way of the mouth.(FDA)
Administration to a particular spot on the outer surface of the body. The E2B term TRANSMAMMARY is a subset of the term TOPICAL.(FDA)
Administration beneath the skin; hypodermic. Synonymous with the term SUBDERMAL.(FDA)
Administration through the dermal layer of the skin to the systemic circulation by diffusion.(FDA)
Administration within the eye.(FDA)
Administration within a muscle.(FDA)
Administration within the respiratory tract by inhaling orally or nasally for local or systemic effect.(FDA)
Administration within or introduced directly into a localized lesion.(FDA)
Administration within the peritoneal cavity.(FDA)
Administration to the nose; administered by way of the nose.(FDA)
Administration into the vagina.(FDA)
Administration to the rectum.(FDA)

codelists.name: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the bag unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the bottle unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the box unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the container unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the disk unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the package unit.(NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Pack Dosing Unit; Package Dosing Unit
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the packet unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the patch unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the tablet unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the tube unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the vial unit.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Drug Dispensed or Returned

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH ECG Original Units codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: ECG Original Units
synonyms: CDISC CDASH ECG Original Units Terminology

terms.definition: A unit of time, which is equal to one thousandth of a second.(NCI)

The second is a unit of time with a duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the cesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.(NCI)
The number of heartbeats measured per minute time. (NCI)

codelists.name: Units for Exposure
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Units for Exposure Terminology

terms.definition: A dosing measurement based on the tablet unit.(NCI)
A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)
The unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, 10E-6 cubic meter, or approximately to 0.061 023 7 cubic inch.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.(NCI)
The unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.(NCI)
A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram. (NCI)

codelists.name: Exposure Dosing Frequency per Interval

terms.definition: Two times per day, at unspecified times. (NCI)
Three times per day. (NCI)
Four times per day. (NCI)
Every other day. (NCI)

As needed. (NCI)

A solid pharmaceutical dosage form that contains medicinal agent within either a hard or soft soluble container or shell, usually used for the oral administration of medicine. The shells are made of a suitable form of gelatin or other substance. (NCI)

A semisolid (1) dosage form that contains a gelling agent to provide stiffness to a solution or a colloidal dispersion (2). A gel may contain suspended particles. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: A colloidal dispersion is a system in which particles of colloidal dimension (i.e., typically between 1 nm and 1 micrometer) are distributed uniformly throughout a liquid.

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption
codelists.preferredTerm: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption
codelists.submissionValue: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption Terminology

terms.definition: The second is a unit of time with a duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the cesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption

terms.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption

terms.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day. (NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Total Volume Administration Unit codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Total Volume Administration Unit
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Total Volume Administration Unit Terminology

terms.definition: The unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, 10E-6 cubic meter, or approximately to 0.061 023 7 cubic inch.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.(NCI)
The unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.(NCI)

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Unit of Measure for Flow Rate codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate
codelists.preferredTerm: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate
codelists.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Unit of Measure for Flow Rate Terminology

terms.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter travels to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one minute. Microgram per minute is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to one minute.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate

terms.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter travels to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Microgram per day is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate

terms.definition: A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter travels during the period of time equal to one minute.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate

terms.definition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a mole of substance travels or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate

terms.definition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a mole of substance travels to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.(NCI)
terms.submissionValue: Unit of Measure for Flow Rate

A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)

A unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.(NCI)
The unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.(NCI)
A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram. (NCI)

codelists.name: Vital Signs Position of Subject
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Vital Signs Position of Subject Terminology

terms.definition: The state or act of one who sits; the posture of one who occupies a seat. (NCI)
The act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position. (NCI)
A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward. (NCI)

codelists.definition: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Never/Current/Former Classification codelist created for CDASH Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification codelist. (NCI)
codelists.name: Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification
synonyms: CDISC CDASH Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification Terminology

terms.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past.
Occurring in or belonging to the present time. (NCI)
Occurring prior to something else. (NCI)
